cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi (175 km) SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: racing west-northwest along the southern coast of Hispaniola today, then toward Jamaica and eastern Cuba Sunday and the Florida Straits early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Hispaniola near the Haiti–Dominican Republic border

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no active watches for Puerto Rico
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – no active warnings for Puerto Rico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Hispaniola, Jamaica, eastern and central Cuba, Florida Keys/Straits; rough seas extend across the eastern Caribbean including Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible in squalls today
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the north coast of Puerto Rico
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches widespread with isolated pockets up to 5 inches creating flash-flood and mud-slide risk in higher terrain
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas for port approaches
